reports.label: Informational Changelog in Section G is Consistent with Normative Text
reports.explanation: Section G contains a changelog that only documents historical edits and is marked for removal, making it purely informational and not impacting normative specifications.
justification: The analysis states: Excerpt Summary: Section G is an editor-only changelog summarizing differences between draft -06/-05/-04/... and earlier versions, referencing already-updated normative text elsewhere in the draft. (E1)

The candidate issue details mention: Candidate Issues: 1 Issue 1: Type: None Label: Changelog is informational and consistent with main text Relevant Dimensions: Sketch: Section G is explicitly marked for removal by the RFC Editor and only narrates edits already visible... (E2)

snippets.text: Excerpt Summary: Section G is an editor-only changelog summarizing differences between draft -06/-05/-04/... and earlier versions, referencing already-updated normative text elsewhere in the draft.

Candidate Issues: 1

  Issue 1:
    Type: None
    Label: Changelog is informational and consistent with main text
    Relevant Dimensions: 
    Sketch: Section G is explicitly marked for removal by the RFC Editor and only narrates edits already visible...

summary: (E1) Excerpt Summary details the editor-only nature of Section G.
(E2) Candidate Issues section identifies the changelog as informational and marked for removal, supporting the non-normative intent.

reports.severity_basis: All evaluation dimensions are marked as LOW and the issue is explicitly noted as Type: None, indicating no functional or normative bug.
